definition: to be called/to be known as

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance

sentences.english: More than 80 percent of the facilities will be built around the Fourth Ring Road .
sentences.chinese: 以上的场馆建在被称做“申奥大道”的四环路周围。

sentences.english: At is time the subject of topology was known as analysis situs .
sentences.chinese: 在这个时候，拓扑学被称做位置几何学。

sentences.english: Such an attack is termed syncope.
sentences.chinese: 象这样的病我们就称做晕厥。

sentences.english: They're the "four wonders" of Mount Huangshan.
Turquoise, steel and royal blue are called the three iridescent colors.
sentences.chinese: 蓝绿色，金属色及皇家蓝色被称做三闪光色。

sentences.english: Two-year colleges in the United States are also known as community colleges.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，两年制的大学也称做社区学院。

sentences.english: Their heads also hold large quantities of a substance called spermaceti.
sentences.chinese: 它们的大脑中还有大量的一种被称做鲸脑的物质。

sentences.english: He tugged the camels to make them get up.
sentences.chinese: 骆驼又被称做“沙漠之舟。”

sentences.english: It is a conundrum in game theory known as a prisoner's dilemma.
sentences.chinese: 这在搏弈理论中被称做囚徒的困境。

sentences.english: This was termed the plum pudding model.
sentences.chinese: 这被称做枣糕布丁模型。

sentences.english: To the people who called us conspiracy nuts, whatcha think now.
sentences.chinese: 那些把我们称做阴谋论疯子的人现在怎么想？

sentences.english: The Dongba characters are also called the Naxi pictographic characters.
sentences.chinese: 所以东巴文也称做纳西象形文字。
平托的这种能力通常被称做“眼球脱臼”。

sentences.english: Bit-mapped graphics are often called raster graphics.
sentences.chinese: 位映像经常被称做光栅图形。

sentences.english: Cats would have been more appropriate than tigers.
sentences.chinese: 将我们这几个人称做猫比虎更贴切。

sentences.english: This pitch-and-rhythm variation, known as prosody, conveys emotion.
sentences.chinese: 这种我们称做声调的节奏与音调变化常常传达着情感。

definition: to be called/to be known as
to be generally referred to (as)/generic term
person (first person, second person etc in grammar)/called/known as
alternative name/to refer to sth by another name/antonomasia
to be known as/to be nicknamed/to be purportedly/to claim (often exaggeratedly or falsely)
to make a general reference/to be used in a general sense
